org.openadaptor.core.node
Class ReadNode

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.core.lifecycle.LifecycleComponent
          org.openadaptor.core.node.Node
              org.openadaptor.core.node.ReadNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, ILifecycleComponent, IMessageProcessor, IRunnable, ITransactionInitiator, java.lang.Runnable
public class ReadNode
extends Node
implements IRunnable, ITransactionInitiator

This class should be used to "wrap" an IReadConnector. It handles the following

  • propogates lifecycle management to IReadConnector
  • polls IReadConnector for data, creates new Message and delegates to configured IMessageProcessor
  • Transaction creation, commit / exception

    This represents the "inpoint" of an Adaptor. Typically an Adaptor is managing the lifecycle of a ReadNode, it sets the TransactionManager and sets itself as the MessageProcessor.
    By virtue of it's subclass, this class can also have an IDataProcessor configured, if this the case then data received from the IReadConnector is processed by the IDataProcessor before being delegated. This by-passes any exception / discard management that can be configured in delegates such as Router.

    Author:
    perryj
    See Also:
    IReadConnector, Adaptor

    getExitError

    public java.lang.Throwable getExitError()
    Specified by:
    getExitError in interface IRunnable
    Returns:
    an unhandled exception, if any occured, from one of the nodes linked to this read node. Null if no exceptions in downstream nodes occured or if all those that did occur were handled by the exception handler.
